name: Frequency: Prior to commencing any activity
Acceptance Criteria: Ensure that all employees and subcontractors are:
– using the correct and complete set of drawings
– all drawings are the latest revision
Reference Documents: Drawings and drawing registers
Record of conformity: This ITP signed
1.2 - Implementation of all measures and controls
Acceptance Criteria: All necessary measures and controls are being implemented, that is: PSP, EMP, TMP, SWMS & WP`
Reference Documents: PSP, EMP, TMP, JSEA, SWMS, WP
Record of conformity: This ITP signed
Acceptance Criteria: Plant and equipment used in the Works are appropriate to achieve specification requirements and is inducted
Record of conformity: This ITP signed
2.1 - The commencement of construction of base and subbase
Acceptance Criteria: After the sub-grade has been compacted to approval, the crushed rock shall be spread in even layers of 150 mm maximum loose thickness.

• The material shall be spread to produce the required consolidated thickness by means of approved mechanical spreader.  The material shall be maintained within +/- 2% of OMC, with additional water being added if required during compaction.
• Materials shall be spread without segregation of large and small particles, between approved edge boards or kerbs
Record of conformity: This ITP signed
Acceptance Criteria: Rolling shall be performed in such a manner as to eliminate bumps and irregularities with the finished surface true to the required grades and cross-section.
Record of conformity: This ITP signed

Acceptance Criteria: Where material is scheduled for measurement by loose volume in delivery vehicles or by mass, a delivery docket for each load shall be issued to the Superintendent at the point of delivery.
Record of conformity: This ITP signed
Acceptance Criteria: Material is to be compacted to the overall thickness shown in the drawings (dependent on pavement type),
• Subgrade to be within  +5mm or - 30mm of design
• Subbase to be within + 10mm or - 20mm of design
• Basecourse thickness to be 0mm from design level
Inspection / Test Method: Visual and Measure
Record of conformity: This ITP signed

Acceptance Criteria: Width of each side of the pavement shall not be less than the specified offset width or more than + 300mm outside the specified offset width when measured at right angles from the centre line or design line.
• Where pavement is to be constructed to the lip level of kerb and channel, it shall be constructed flush with the lip of the channel or not more than 5 mm above.
• Any material that has been compacted and then trimmed from the compacted surface to conform
Record of conformity: This ITP signed
Acceptance Criteria: (a) material shall be spread in such a manner as to minimise the number of joints
(b) transverse joints shall be offset from one layer to the next by not less than 2m
(c) longitudinal joints shall be offset from one layer to the next by not less than 150mm
Record of conformity: This ITP signed
Acceptance Criteria: All pavement layers shall be compacted to withstand rolling and shall be test rolled in accordance with table 5 of section C.7.2 prior to acceptance of the layer.
Record of conformity: This ITP signed
Acceptance Criteria: The minimum compaction achieved shall be 100% of the Standard Maximum Dry Density in the base course, and 98% of the Standard Maximum Dry Density in the sub-base course
Record of conformity: This ITP signed
Acceptance Criteria: Surveyed as constructed drawings to be provided showing finished contour levels.
○ Spreading, scraping and consolidation of the various layers of the pavement shall proceed with each layer having a construction tolerance of;
Record of conformity: This ITP signed
Acceptance Criteria: Layer to be finished to a smooth and uniform surface and after compaction and meeting the following tolerances:
• Surface: + or - 15mm when tested with a 3m straight edge, laid in any direction.
• Longitudional Grades: The gutter grade shall be + or - 20% of the design grade.
Record of conformity: This ITP signed
The signature below verifies that this ITP has been completed in accordance with the FH’s Quality system Procedures and verifies lot compliance with specifications.
